content.description: Difficult fingercrack for 15 feet, then the angle eases off and you can climb as high as you wish on good rock.
content.location: On The Holy Wall, far left, past the holes, the best and hardest of a few variations on great rock.

content.description: There is a small plant growing out of the wall near the waterline that marks the start of this awesome route! Get established on some good jugs. Steep, pumpy jug-fest that leads to some incredible terrain! Current high point is about 30 feet over the water as of the time of this writing.
content.protection: deep water, safe falls the whole way
content.location: There is a little green bush that's growing out of the wall right at the base of the route. Starts just left of this bush. This is a step-off-the-bow problem. It would be MUCH harder if attempting from the water.

content.description: Quiet area with a bunch of steep rock just upstream from The River Crag a few hundred yards on the same side of the canyon. It is an enchanting little spot and will be quiet on days when the lake is crowded.
